comment: He is very unclear. His questions on test ask one thing but he expects something else. Assignments are hard and often he had to give back because everyone failed. But only if enough students complain. We started this class with max students and ended with about 8. He does curve your final grade but who knows where you stand prior to that.

He is very unclear. His questions on test ask one thing but he expects something else. Assignments are hard and often he had to give back because everyone failed. But only if enough students complain. We started this class with max students and ended with about 8. He does curve your final grade but who knows where you stand prior to that.

A hands-off professor. A little tough at first, but if you do what he tells you to do, he is easy. Hard to understand for lecture, very soft spoken. He curves the class grades. Pay attention to his lectures and memorize the code... do not expect tons of help from him... Final project was class graded they were harder on  each other than he was.

Once told all of us that if we didn't finish an assignment within a certain number of days, we should kill ourselves. We believe he was joking, but the half-horrified chuckles around the classroom said it all. Why he was teaching game programming when he readily admits he's never played a game before, I'll never understand.

Not knowledgeable in the topic for the course.  Has unclear requirements and uses an unknown grading scale.  Posts reviews for test less than one day before.  Claims never received homework when sent, then refuses to show he didn't receive it.  Doesn't share code on topics and will not assist in code debugging.  Don't take this guy.  He is useless.
Very difficult. Grades very strict. Don't be surprised if he counts off for things you didn't know you needed.
Not very clear or helpful. I have no doubt he is smart, but he doesn't convey his knowledge well. Also, his grading system is horrible.

Smart man, VERY hard to understand. I just could not understand him with his accent. I have nothing against people from other countries, but if they do not have very good english, they should not be teaching in this country.

He is extremly hard to understand and very strict when grading. He gives a quiz every other day. The tests are hard but his grading makes it even harder. The material is somewhat interesting, but he presents boolean functions as the most important concept in the world when it clearly isn't. I would not recommend him for he is a terrible teacher.

Good teacher, sometimes you can't tell when he's asking a question. Class was good, it should be taught in a computer lab (either that or you better have a good powerfull pc/laptop) because of the tool used (Java Studio Creator). Tests are OK, expect to write codes in the test even though you hardly do any coding with the tool. DON'T BUY BOOK!
He is hard to understand, but is he very helpfull when asked.
He is very knowledgeable about his material but does not transmit the information clearly. Very confusing...too many assignments without enough support...almost half the class dropped off
